dt.t: His imagination had so {wi}abstracted{/wi} him that his name was called twice before he answered.
She {wi}abstracted{/wi} important documents from the safe.

dt: {bc}to consider apart from application to or association with a particular instance

quotes.t: … artists in the group put the emphasis on geometric abstraction rather than images {qword}abstracted{/qword} from nature.
… the Romantic project was to {qword}abstract{/qword} from religion its essential "feeling" and leave contemptuously behind its traditional formulations.
… basic esthetic criteria and standards he has {qword}abstracted{/qword} from long intimacy with time-tested masterpieces.
… conscientiously and with great purity made the uncompromising effort to {qword}abstract{/qword} his view of life into an art work …

et: Middle English {it}abstracten{/it} "to draw away, remove," derivative of {it}abstract{/it} {et_link|abstract:1|abstract:1} (or borrowed directly from Latin {it}abstractus{/it})
shortdef: to make a summary or abstract of : summarize
to draw away the attention of
